Package com.es.unex.practica_sistemas_inteligentes

Class Individual

java.lang.Object
com.es.unex.practica_sistemas_inteligentes.Individual
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Individual>
public class Individual
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Individual>, java.lang.Cloneable
Class that defines the structure and actions of an individual. Essential within the program because all the execution is based on the use of individuals. Implements the interface Cloneable to carry out the cloning of the individual, so as not to having problems during subsequent changes Implement the Comparable interface to make the comparison between individuals and in order to order them by fitness value
Version:
0.1
Author:
eliapacioni

  • Constructor Details

    • Individual

      public Individual()
      Builder with no parameters, no individual.

    • Individual

      public Individual​(int nMaxAntennas)
      Parameters:
      nMaxAntennas - maximum number of antennas that can compose the individual It instantiates the individual by defining only the maximum number of antennas that can compose it, without defining some value.

    • Individual

      public Individual​(int nMaxAntena, Antenna[] modAntennas, int gridWidth, Accident[] accidents)
      Parameters:
      nMaxAntena - maximum number of antennas that can compose the individual
      modAntennas - available antenna models
      gridWidth - grid width
      accidents - Geographic accidents He instantiates the individual by setting all his characteristics, each time an antenna is created it evaluates whether is valid and in case it solves the problem.

  • Method Details

    • evaluate

      public void evaluate​(int gridWidth, Accident[] accidents, CoverageArea[] aCoverage, int avgCostAntennas, int weightingAreas, int weightingCost, int weightingConnection)
      Parameters:
      gridWidth - gird witdh
      accidents - geographical incidents
      aCoverage - areas to cover
      avgCostAntennas - average cost of antennas
      weightingAreas - importance of area coverage in the algorithm
      weightingCost - importance of keeping the cost of antennas low in the algorithm
      weightingConnection - importance of connection between areas Evaluates the individual and saves his fitness value

    • insertAntennasArea

      private int[][] insertAntennasArea​(int gridWidth)
      Parameters:
      gridWidth - grid width
      Returns:
      grid containing the antennas Place the antennas of an individual within the grid

    • insertAccidents

      private int[][] insertAccidents​(int[][] zonaTotal, Accident[] accidents)
      Parameters:
      zonaTotal - total grid containing the antennas
      accidents - geographical incidents
      Returns:
      total grid containing antennas and incidents Always call after you place the antennas.

    • areaToEvaluate

      private java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> areaToEvaluate​(int[][] zonaTotal, CoverageArea[] aCoverage)
      Parameters:
      zonaTotal - area containing the antennas and the geographical incidents
      aCoverage - areas to cover
      Returns:
      extracts the zones to be covered and returns an ArrayList containing the zones interested.

    • mutate

      public void mutate​(Antenna[] antennas)
      Parameters:
      antennas - models of available antennas Apply the mutation to the individual, changing a pattern of antenna, chosen randomly, but keeping the position of the previous antenna

    • mutate

      public void mutate​(int gridWidth, Accident[] accidents)
      Parameters:
      gridWidth - grid width
      accidents - geographical incidents Apply the mutation to the individual, changing position of a randomly chosen antenna.

    • antennaInvalid

      private boolean antennaInvalid​(int index, Accident[] accidents)
      Parameters:
      index - index of the antenna to be verified
      accidents - geographical incidents
      Returns:
      false: antenna valid, true: antenna invalid Check if an antenna is invalid. An antenna is invalid if it is placed on top of another antenna or on top of a geographical incident.

    • isInvalid

      public boolean isInvalid​(Accident[] accidents)
      Parameters:
      accidents - Geographic accidents
      Returns:
      false: valid, true: invalid Check if an individual is disabled. An individual is disabled if he has at least one invalid antenna.

    • evaluaAreasConnections

      private float evaluaAreasConnections​(CoverageArea[] aCoverage)
      Parameters:
      aCoverage - coverage areas
      Returns:
      fitness [0,1] Assesses whether the areas are connected to each other and attributes a fitness

    • isConnected

      private boolean isConnected​(Antenna init, Antenna end)
      Parameters:
      init - first antenna
      end - second antenna
      Returns:
      true: connection, false: no connection Check if there is a connection between two antennas
